messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Asteroids are rocks that fly through space. Some of these are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids'. This means they can pass very close to Earth, within 7.5 million kilometres. NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these special asteroids. However, none of them are a danger for the next one hundred years. With the technology we have now, NASA can follow these objects. They can also predict if one might hit Earth. If that happens, there are two ways to defend our planet.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. The text uses multiple unexplained B2 words. 'Potentially', 'predict', and 'defend' are all above B1 level and are not defined. The term 'Hazardous' is also too advanced. B2 vocabulary is only permitted for defined keywords. This text is not immediately understandable by a B1 learner.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Asteroids are rocks that fly through space. Some of these asteroids could be dangerous. They are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' because they can pass very close to Earth, inside a distance of 7.5 million kilometres. NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these special asteroids. However, none of them are a danger for the next one hundred years. With the technology we have now, NASA can follow these objects. They can also know in advance if one might hit Earth. If that happens, there are two ways to protect our planet.
